brewery.brewery_description: Marston's disposed of its brewing operations in 2020, selling assets to a joint venture with the Carlsberg Group to create the Carlsberg Marston's Brewing Company.

location.venue_address: Mayorazgo de Orduña No. 35, Col. Xoco

beer.beer_description:
Available in bottles at 5.3% ABV and cans at 5% ABV.

Heftily hopped & aroma packed, Hobgoblin IPA stays true to its ancestral traditions. Brewed with Fuggles, Goldings & Styrian hops & then amped up by the addition of some mighty American hops. This collision of Old & New World hops provides an explosion of tropical aroma & a juicy bitterness. Born out of character.

items.badge_description: 99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 190 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 39!

user.bio: Home brewer, dry hopper and world champion drinker. Honk Honk!!

beer.beer_description:
This beer is available in multiple ABV's. It's all the same beer, and does not require seperate entries.
5.2% ABV in bottle
4.5% ABV on cask and in cans
3.5% for the Swedish market

Traditionally brewed to produce a wonderfully well balanced blend of smooth, rich & satisfying flavours from chocolate & crystal malts combined with a crisp, refreshing bitterness from Styrian, Goldings and Fuggles hops.

A unique and original beer with a character not unlike the Hobgoblin himself - surprisingly likeable... once you get to know him...

items.checkin_comment: Maybe the last of the Christmas beers?

beer.beer_description: Brown / Amber seasonal winter ale. Spice and fruit with banana clove.

user.bio: If you are on FB, Instagram or Twitter find me at All About Beer Ireland. Slàinte!

items.badge_description: As the hub of the town's social scene, your local pub has what you're craving. Be sure to stop by for a pint or two! That's a beer at 490 different venues with the categories of Pub, Irish Pub or Gastropub. Visit 5 more for Level 99!

items.checkin_comment:
500ml Flasche in London. Bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit festem weissem Schaum. Wenig Aroma. Röstmalz ind etwas Nuss. Süffiger Geschmack. Süsslich bitter. Etwas Vanille im Abgang.

beer.beer_description: Brewed with our legendary Burton water. Palate of biscuit malt, spicy hops and light fruitiness.  Now with added personality.

Available in bottles at 5.3% ABV and cans at 5% ABV.

Heftily hopped & aroma packed, Hobgoblin IPA stays true to its ancestral traditions. Brewed with Fuggles, Goldings & Styrian hops & then amped up by the addition of some mighty American hops. This collision of Old & New World hops provides an explosion of tropical aroma & a juicy bitterness. Born out of character.
Brown / Amber seasonal winter ale. Spice and fruit with banana clove.

items.badge_description: Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 5 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 2!

While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 10 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 3!

items.checkin_comment: Hobgoblin with my hobgoblin (whose bad at darts)

Traditionally brewed to produce a wonderfully well balanced blend of smooth, rich & satisfying flavours from chocolate & crystal malts combined with a crisp, refreshing bitterness from Styrian, Goldings and Fuggles hops.

A unique and original beer with a character not unlike the Hobgoblin himself - surprisingly likeable... once you get to know him...

items.badge_description: Round and round the wheel goes! Which style you’ll be drinking, nobody knows! Your desire to explore different styles is inspiring. Keep it up! That's a check-in to at least 35 different styles. Try 5 more for Level 8!

beer.beer_description:
Draft 6% ABV
Bottle 6.6% ABV

A the full moon casts its eerie light over the shadowy old Eagle Brewery, a magical brew gurgles forth from the casks.

A beer enlivened by the energies of the universe, when the elements are converging into a harmonious alignment. Truly a brew fit for a celestial majesty.

King Goblin is hand crafted from roasted chocolate and crystal malts, with a timely infusion of fuggles, sovereign, styrian and cascade hops to produce an indulgently rich, full, smooth beer of exceptional quality and character.

A full, rich, sublimely fruity & satisfying indulgent beer; a beer for the connoisseur of the finer things.

Available in bottles at 5.3% ABV and cans at 5% ABV.

Heftily hopped & aroma packed, Hobgoblin IPA stays true to its ancestral traditions. Brewed with Fuggles, Goldings & Styrian hops & then amped up by the addition of some mighty American hops. This collision of Old & New World hops provides an explosion of tropical aroma & a juicy bitterness. Born out of character.

Full hop flavour
Hobgoblin Session IPA is a 3.4% light, easy drinking and extremely refreshing beer. Pale yellow, packed with 5 New World hops delivering a fresh and zesty aroma. Enjoy this Session IPA without compromising on the intense tropical fruit and citrus hoppyness.

4.5%  bottle 4.2% cask. The combination of four hop varieties & an infusion of wheat & malted barley results in a perfectly balanced golden beer - with a huge hop punch. Well what would you expect? Hops - Pilgrim; Nelson, Citra and Summit.

items.badge_description: While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 475 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 96!

beer.beer_description: With aromas of roasted malts and chocolate, enjoy the earthy bitterness balanced by hints of coffee, cocoa and sweet treacle flavours. This Stout is a deceptively dark, yet smooth and easy drinking beer.

items.badge_description: It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That’s 205 check-ins with a photo.

Whether you’re feeling extra special or extra strong, stopping by the local pub for a delicious Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter is always a good decision! That's 10 different beers with the style of Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter. Try 5 more for Level 3!

items.checkin_comment: A spicy Hobgoblin, a bit harsh at first but got used it

beer.beer_description: Brown / Amber seasonal winter ale. Spice and fruit with banana clove.

beer.beer_description:
This beer is available in multiple ABV's. It's all the same beer, and does not require seperate entries.
5.2% ABV in bottle
4.5% ABV on cask and in cans
3.5% for the Swedish market

Traditionally brewed to produce a wonderfully well balanced blend of smooth, rich & satisfying flavours from chocolate & crystal malts combined with a crisp, refreshing bitterness from Styrian, Goldings and Fuggles hops.

A unique and original beer with a character not unlike the Hobgoblin himself - surprisingly likeable... once you get to know him...

4.5%  bottle 4.2% cask. The combination of four hop varieties & an infusion of wheat & malted barley results in a perfectly balanced golden beer - with a huge hop punch. Well what would you expect? Hops - Pilgrim; Nelson, Citra and Summit.
Brewed with our legendary Burton water. Palate of biscuit malt, spicy hops and light fruitiness.  Now with added personality.

A refreshing golden beer, lightly hopped with subtle sweet notes and a delicate citrus aroma.

Originally brewed as a seasonal beer, Wainwright was so unusually refreshing that it became an instant hit with drinkers throughout the UK.

Malt: Marris Otter

Hops: Magnum, Tradition, Hersbrucker and Stryian Goldings

Available in bottles at 5.3% ABV and cans at 5% ABV.

Heftily hopped & aroma packed, Hobgoblin IPA stays true to its ancestral traditions. Brewed with Fuggles, Goldings & Styrian hops & then amped up by the addition of some mighty American hops. This collision of Old & New World hops provides an explosion of tropical aroma & a juicy bitterness. Born out of character.

Draft 6% ABV
Bottle 6.6% ABV

A the full moon casts its eerie light over the shadowy old Eagle Brewery, a magical brew gurgles forth from the casks.

A beer enlivened by the energies of the universe, when the elements are converging into a harmonious alignment. Truly a brew fit for a celestial majesty.

King Goblin is hand crafted from roasted chocolate and crystal malts, with a timely infusion of fuggles, sovereign, styrian and cascade hops to produce an indulgently rich, full, smooth beer of exceptional quality and character.

A full, rich, sublimely fruity & satisfying indulgent beer; a beer for the connoisseur of the finer things.

A memorable and deceptively easy-drinking IPA. This is an authentic recreation of the beer style created for, and enjoyed throughout, the Empire. Goldings, Fuggles and American Cascade hops combine to give a crisp, citrus hop aroma, with a balanced, bittersweet finish. Strong and very memorable.
English Session Pale Ale A light, golden beer. Inviting fruity hop aroma. Refreshing, zesty finish. Pick me.

This chestnut-coloured beer is brewed using pale ale and crystal malt, which gives it a full-bodied flavour. A finely balanced hop character is enriched by the late addition of Styrian Goldings to give a prominent floral hop aroma and fuller flavour.
Pale Ale. Five American and Australian hops. Fresh, zesty aroma. Tropical fruit and citrus notes. Dive in.
English Oyster Stout. Available in 4.1% and 4.5%ABV. Hints of chocolate, coffee and sweet treacle flavours and yet quite smooth and clean-tasting.

Brewed in the UK by Marston's in collaboration with Shipyard, it has a distinctive spicy and nutty malt flavour to a pale ale packed full of fruity hop character. A pale ale with a twist from Simon Yates, Master Brewer at our Park Brewery in Wolverhampton. Inspired by certain American brewers, the inclusion of rye crystal malt adds a distinctive spicy and nutty malt flavour to a pale ale packed full of fruity hop character, from a cocktail of five different American hop varieties.

Bottle ABV: 4.1%, Cask ABV: 3.8%.
An exotic Pale Golden Ale brewed with a blend of Australian hops.

Owd Rodger, brewed to a recipe believed to be over 500 years old, is Marston’s award winning 7.6% strong ale. Brewed using malted barley, whole leaf English aroma hops and well water, Owd Rodger offers an explosion of rich fruit flavours with a dry bitter-sweet finish.

Manns is the Original Brown Ale, first brewed at the Mann's Whitechapel brewery in 1902. The historic recipe produces a dark, rich, full bodied ale with a luscious flavour and hints of roasted creamy toffee.

Full hop flavour
Hobgoblin Session IPA is a 3.4% light, easy drinking and extremely refreshing beer. Pale yellow, packed with 5 New World hops delivering a fresh and zesty aroma. Enjoy this Session IPA without compromising on the intense tropical fruit and citrus hoppyness.

Brewed with 100% English malt, Wainwright Amber (4.0% ABV) is a fantastically refreshing new beer that looks to expand the Wainwright brand to new audiences and even greater success, combining the brand’s reputation for great ales with the popularity of the Amber Ale style.

Inviting with its attractive amber colour and a scent hinting of spice, Wainwright Amber offers a clean, creamy drinking experience, with a malty and lightly fruity flavour delivering gentle bitterness.

Marston’s Resolution delivers punchy flavours and lots of character. In order to deliver all of that wonderful flavour, which Marston’s is renowned for, Marston’s Resolution undergoes a double fermentation process which turns all sugars into alcohol. 

The end result is a strong, refreshing beer that’s less filling and easier to drink. Not only this, but it’s also great tasting with lots of full-bodied flavours which are finished off with a refreshing, crisp note.

With aromas of roasted malts and chocolate, enjoy the earthy bitterness balanced by hints of coffee, cocoa and sweet treacle flavours. This Stout is a deceptively dark, yet smooth and easy drinking beer.

A juicy, tropical pale ale, with a fullness that bellies its low alcohol. Generous quantities of hops are added throughout the brewing process and it is those hops that deliver Low Tide’s richly fruity hop character, with tropical fruits, and notes of subtle citrus and blueberry.
A fresh and smooth aromatic ale, brewed with full bodied pale and wheat malts, balanced by a zesty citrus and earthy bouquet from the late addition of enticing and fragrant hops.

Wainwright Altitude Chilled Cask is served at 5º degrees and is 4% ABV. It has been developed to meet three key customer points – 1. Cold and refreshing 2. Changing consumer tastes/demands 3. Younger audience. (From Beer Guild)

Crafted using the almost forgotten "double dropping" fermentation technique and a late application of hops, Marston's Double Drop delivers a fresher and brighter beer that brings out the full clean flavour of the malt.
